meanings.definition: Serving as a temporary or conditional measure.
meanings.sent1: The provisory agreement allowed them to test the new system before committing fully.
meanings.sent2: She made a provisory decision to postpone the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent3: The provisory plan to have a picnic in the rain was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: His provisory solution to the problem was like a band-aid on a broken arm.
meanings.sent5: The provisory nature of the contract made it easy to change if needed.

meanings.definition: Contingent upon certain conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The provisory approval was granted only if they met the safety requirements.
meanings.sent2: Her provisory acceptance of the job depended on the salary offer.
meanings.sent3: The provisory promise to bring cake to the party was amusingly uncertain.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was provisory, like a delicate balance waiting to tip.
meanings.sent5: The provisory nature of the truce kept everyone on edge.
